comment: * Stores information about a particular Task.

variables.name: userId
variables.comment:
* The id of the user the task was running as.
     * @hide

variables.name: stackId
variables.comment:
* The id of the ActivityStack that currently contains this task.
     * @hide

variables.name: taskId
variables.comment: * The identifier for this task.

variables.name: isRunning
variables.comment: * Whether or not this task has any running activities.

variables.name: baseIntent
variables.comment:
* The base intent of the task (generally the intent that launched the task). This intent can
     * be used to relaunch the task (if it is no longer running) or brought to the front if it is.

variables.name: baseActivity
variables.comment:
* The component of the first activity in the task, can be considered the "application" of this
     * task.

variables.name: topActivity
variables.comment: * The component of the top activity in the task, currently showing to the user.

variables.name: origActivity
variables.comment:
* The component of the target activity if this task was started from an activity alias.
     * Otherwise, this is null.

variables.name: realActivity
variables.comment:
* The component of the activity that started this task (may be the component of the activity
     * alias).
     * @hide

variables.name: numActivities
variables.comment: * The number of activities in this task (including running).

variables.name: lastActiveTime
variables.comment:
* The last time this task was active since boot (including time spent in sleep).
     * @hide

variables.name: displayId
variables.comment:
* The id of the display this task is associated with.
     * @hide

variables.name: taskDescription
variables.comment:
* The recent activity values for the highest activity in the stack to have set the values.
     * {@link Activity#setTaskDescription(android.app.ActivityManager.TaskDescription)}.

variables.name: supportsSplitScreenMultiWindow
variables.comment:
* True if the task can go in the split-screen primary stack.
     * @hide

variables.name: resizeMode
variables.comment:
* The resize mode of the task. See {@link ActivityInfo#resizeMode}.
     * @hide

variables.name: configuration
variables.comment:
* The current configuration of the task.
     * @hide

variables.name: token
variables.comment:
* Used as an opaque identifier for this task.
     * @hide

variables.name: pictureInPictureParams
variables.comment:
* The PictureInPictureParams for the Task, if set.
     * @hide

variables.name: topActivityType
variables.comment:
* The activity type of the top activity in this task.
     * @hide

variables.name: topActivityInfo
variables.comment:
* The {@link ActivityInfo} of the top activity in this task.
     * @hide

variables.name: isResizeable
variables.comment:
* Whether this task is resizable. Unlike {@link #resizeMode} (which is what the top activity
     * supports), this is what the system actually uses for resizability based on other policy and
     * developer options.
     * @hide

methods.name: void readFromParcel(Parcel source)
methods.comment: * Reads the TaskInfo from a parcel.

methods.name: void writeToParcel(Parcel dest, int flags)
methods.comment: * Writes the TaskInfo to a parcel.
